result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J Melby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eric J Melby is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eric J Melby was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Payment Plan:  $50.00 per month, commencing on 9/1/16.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric J Melby

defendant.name: Melby, Eric J
defendant.address: W1038 Cth Rd X, Portage, WI 53901

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Eric J Melby in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee is amending the complaint to add Count 3 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01 without the domestic abuse enhancer.  Based on that amendment; the defendant will plea to Ct. 3.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the added Ct. 3.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court allows Atty Hendee to amend the complaint to add Ct. 3, Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1) without the enhancer.

Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. 
BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 3, Disorderly Conduct.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 3, Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1):  Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2016

Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed.
Plea hearing on August 3, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric J Melby
Current: W1038 Cth Rd X, Portage, WI 53901   (Effective: 11-09-2015)
Prior: W10380 Cth Rd X, Portage, WI 53901

Final pre-trial at 05-27-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 07-14-2016 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in Columbia County jail w/Probation being revoked.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea and asks for a trial to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea already entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
*No contact with Jamie Melby  *No contact with S.C.M. (dob 1/18/99)  *No contact with Hector Garcia

Defendant Eric J Melby in custody by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz who appears by phone.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Gumz waives further reading.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz responds.
BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause and sets signature bond.  Return date scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
